data.title: Abraham Brown (abt.1644-1714)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Abraham Brown born abt. 1644 Portsmouth, Rhode Island died 1714 Mansfield, Burlington, New Jersey including parents + descendants + 5 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Descendants

Profile last modified 27 Jan 2024 | Created 7 Feb 2011

This page has been accessed 2,839 times.

Biography

Abraham was a Friend (Quaker)

Birth

Abraham Brown, son of Nicholas, was born about 1644 in the early Portsmouth Colony, Rhode Island. His birth year is uncertain [1] but Abraham is named in his father's Will. Based upon his fathers probated estate inventory Nicholas was a farmer and shepherd during a time when the colonies of Massachusetts Bay were bastions of "relentless intolerance in the service of a Puritan state." [2] In 1655 Nicholas Brown (Sen.) was one of the Monmouth, New Jersey Patent investors granted by New York Governor Nicholls on behalf of the Duke of York, brother of King Charles II. [3] In 1665 settlers from Long Island and Rhode Island relocated to establish the settlements of Shrewsbury and Middleton in Monmouth county. The settlers reached "more than 100" the limit set by them at their general assembly in 1668. These landowners were also residents and heads of families and they included from Rhode Island Abraham Brown (Sen.), his brother Nicholas Brown (Jun.), [4]

Marriage and Children

Unless he married later than usual records have been lost as the identity of Abraham Brown's (first?) wife. [1] It also appears there were no surviving children from this earlier marriage if there was one as author Hornor believes. In his Will wife Mary and their children are named. Mary's last name at birth (LNAB) is Unknown although many family tree's make the assumption it was Potter. Author Hornor states that the surname Potter is conjecture [1] because there are no vital records during her life to support this assumption.

Abraham and Mary (Unknown) Brown had the following children:

Martha, author Hornor mentions her as a dau. [1] but she's the only child not mentioned in her father's Will., she may have d. bef that event in 1714; m. John Hampton of Middletown, 3rd 5th (Mar) 1687, at Shrewsbury, Monmouth, N.J.

Elizabeth, [1] ; m. Thomas Allfree

Sara, [1] b. 1669 ; m. Ephraim Potter ; d. 6 Sep 1715

Abraham Jr, [1] b. abt. 1672, New Jersey; m. 1st 1692 at Middletown, NJ "Abraham Brown of Shrewsbury m. Leah Clayton of Middletown on 29th of 7th mo (May) 1692 at house of John Clayton. Witnesses: Abraham Brown (Sr.) Nicolas Brown, Sen., Nicolas Brown Jun., Mary Brown...and others. [5] ; he 2nd in 1719 Mary (Unknown) recorded at Burlington MM; yr 1707 residence Mansfield, Burlington, NJ (NJ Early Census Index)

Nicholas, [1] b. abt. d. 1721; m. Elizabeth dau Abijah Edwards of Manahockins

Preserve, [1] b. abt. 1678; m. 1700 Mary Unknown (Potter?) ; he d. 26th 4th mo. (Feb) 1744 age 65 yrs [Bordentown MM, being a branch of the Chesterfield MM]; his Will probated 26 Jun 1744, Burlington, NJ

William, [1] b. abt. 1681, Portsmouth, R.I.; d. 1749; Will proved 10 Jul 1749 at Providence, R.I.

Caleb, [1]

Various Recorded Events During his Life

1688 July 13 "Nicholas Browne of Shroesberry. Bond of, to prosecute the caveat against granting to Jedidiah Allen, a patent for 20 acres at G---- Neck. [Monmouth Wills] [6]

1689 "Abraham who was witness to a wedding: 1689, 9th of 11th mo., [in margin 10th of 2d mo., 1690], Robert Ray md. to Jenett Hampton , both of Shrews. , at house of John Hampton." (Stillwell, John E.)

In 1692 Abraham and Mary Brown were witnesses to the wedding of Abraham's son Abraham of Shrewsbury., who m. 1692, 29th of 7th mo., [in margin 4th of 12th mo., 1692], Leah Clayton, she of Middletown, on fifth day of week, at house of John Clayton." [1]

On 24 May 1703 Abraham Brown is mentioned in the Will of Francis Borden of Shrewsbury, yeoman who prior to his death had purchased land from Abraham in Shrewsbury. [6]

In a 7 October 1705 Abraham is mentioned in a Will [proved January 6, 1706-7: Lib. 1, p. 164, Monmouth Wills] for one William Aston where it's noted that William Aston's daughter Mary, "who married an Indian named Peter Powell", is residing with Abraham Brown in West Jersey near Croswicks Creek. [6] [Crosswicks is about 8 miles from Mansfield, NJ.]

"1705 Oct. 7 - Aston, William, of Shrowberry, weaver, "antient and crasey (crazy);" will of. Wife Janett; daughter Mary, "living with Abraham Brown in West Jersey neare Croswicks Creek, who I heare is maryed unto an Indian, who Calleth his name Peter Powell, as I am Informed..."

Death and Will

Abraham Brown of Mansfield died before 10 July 1714, Burlington county, N.J. when his Will was proved. [1]

"Will of Abraham Brown dated 5 May 1714. Wife Mary. Of Mansfield, Burlington Co., Planter". Children (of Abraham and Mary): Preserve; Nicholas; William; Caleb; Sara; Elizabeth; Abraham Jr,; grandson Thomas Potter."

Estate Value: "Real Estate in East Jersey; home farm, a lot in Burlington, personal property; Son Abraham (Jr.) Executor. Witnesses-Margaret Dosen; Naomi Norton; Richard Norton. Will Proved 10 July 1714. (Lib.I,p.461). On 1714 July 23. Inventory of the personal estate, L217.11.8, made by Peter Frettwell and Joshua Humphris.[7]

Research Notes

In response to the question posted immediately below this reply: No he was not the son of Abraham Browne of Watertown. Visit that person's WikiTree profile for proof.

Was he actually the son of Abraham Browne of Watertown, Massachusetts? please see attached file.[8] Page 3: https://www.ancestry.com/sharing/1064123?mark=57922c6a2929c3306a5b1a829ab7428741a5553c066852c9c9645abb8653d59e
